name: Azure Application Gateway Orchestrator
description: The Azure Application Gateway Orchestrator Extension is an extension to the Keyfactor Universal Orchestrator that allows for the management of certificates on Azure Application Gateways, including the ability to add and bind certificates to HTTPS listeners.

store_types.Name: Azure Application Gateway Certificate
store_types.ClientMachineDescription: The Azure Tenant (directory) ID that owns the Service Principal.
store_types.StorePathDescription: Azure resource ID of the application gateway, following the format: /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-name>/providers/Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways/<application-gateway-name>.

Properties.Name: ServerUsername
Properties.Description: Application ID of the service principal, representing the identity used for managing the Application Gateway.

Properties.Name: ServerPassword
Properties.Description: A Client Secret that the extension will use to authenticate with the Azure Resource Management API for managing Application Gateway certificates, OR the password that encrypts the private key in ClientCertificate

Properties.Name: ClientCertificate
Properties.Description: The client certificate used to authenticate with Azure Resource Management API for managing Application Gateway certificates. See the [requirements](#client-certificate-or-client-secret) for more information.

Properties.Name: AzureCloud
Properties.Description: Specifies the Azure Cloud instance used by the organization.

Properties.Name: ServerUseSsl
Properties.Description: Specifies whether SSL should be used for communication with the server. Set to 'true' to enable SSL, and 'false' to disable it.

store_types.Name: Azure Application Gateway Certificate Binding
store_types.ClientMachineDescription: The Azure Tenant (directory) ID that owns the Service Principal.
store_types.StorePathDescription: Azure resource ID of the application gateway, following the format: /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-name>/providers/Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways/<application-gateway-name>.

Properties.Name: ServerUsername
Properties.Description: Application ID of the service principal, representing the identity used for managing the Application Gateway.

Properties.Name: ServerPassword
Properties.Description: A Client Secret that the extension will use to authenticate with the Azure Resource Management API for managing Application Gateway certificates, OR the password that encrypts the private key in ClientCertificate

Properties.Name: ClientCertificate
Properties.Description: The client certificate used to authenticate with Azure Resource Management API for managing Application Gateway certificates. See the [requirements](#client-certificate-or-client-secret) for more information.

Properties.Name: AzureCloud
Properties.Description: Specifies the Azure Cloud instance used by the organization.

Properties.Name: ServerUseSsl
Properties.Description: Specifies whether SSL should be used for communication with the server. Set to 'true' to enable SSL, and 'false' to disable it.

AzureAppGw.ClientMachine: The Azure Tenant ID of the service principal, representing the Tenant ID where the Application/Service Principal is managed.
AzureAppGw.StorePath: Azure resource ID of the application gateway, following the format: `/subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-name>/providers/Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways/<application-gateway-name>`.

Properties.ServerUsername: Application ID of the service principal, representing the identity used for managing the Application Gateway.
Properties.ServerPassword: Secret of the service principal that will be used to manage the Application Gateway.
Properties.ServerUseSsl: Indicates whether SSL usage is enabled for the connection.
Properties.AzureCloud: Specifies the Azure Cloud instance used by the organization.

AppGwBin.ClientMachine: The Azure Tenant ID of the service principal, representing the Tenant ID where the Application/Service Principal is managed.
AppGwBin.StorePath: Azure resource ID of the application gateway, following the format: `/subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-name>/providers/Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways/<application-gateway-name>`.

Properties.ServerUsername: Application ID of the service principal, representing the identity used for managing the Application Gateway.
Properties.ServerPassword: Secret of the service principal that will be used to manage the Application Gateway.
Properties.ServerUseSsl: Indicates whether SSL usage is enabled for the connection.
Properties.AzureCloud: Specifies the Azure Cloud instance used by the organization.
